intro: Stemonoporus nitidus subsp. lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stemonoporus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are typically glossy and arranged oppositely along the stem. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbellate inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
